column1: # Blank lines and comment lines in this file are ignored.  The first non-blank
# non-comment line must be a list of field names.  Otherwise the order of
# entries in this file doesn't matter.  make_awards_list.pl will sort the awards
# Note: The URL field may contain just a bare date (i.e. the date of a git

column2: if there's no web URL that refers to the award.

column3: For "a nice comeback" (a.k.a. seeing that fiddler crab).
For being the first to recompile his package for Cygwin 1.5.0.
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For updating the URLs in cygport to https.
For a heroic 1-2 punch on a bug.
For organizing the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For adopting a whole pile of orphaned perl packages.
For adopting and fixing a longstanding problem in the `rcs` package.
For the offer to take over Cygwin/X maintainership.
For integrating Mintty shortcuts into setup.
For overhauling automatic dependency selection in setup.
For adding the package search feature in setup (hear, hear).
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For responsiveness in maintaining the gold star page.
For volunteering to maintain the gold star page.
For patience, bravery, manliness, etc. in maintaining the `unison*` packages.
For patience, insight, and helpfulness on the mailing lists.
For explaining why we all need to test Cygwin snapshots.
For good advice and determination to help on the Cygwin list.
For solving an Apache startup failure.
For spearheading the dwarf-2 effort for Cygwin.
For fixing a mailing list gateway breakage.
For explaining why people should help out.
For giving quick, concise, and helpful answers on the Cygwin lists.
For lifetime achievement and contributions to the Cygwin project.
For keeping the Cygwin list on topic.
For good work on Cygwin for the past 7 years and being mean only when it's absolutely necessary.
For maintaining lots of packages over the years.
For maintaining the w32api package for 9 years.
For finding and fixing her own 16-year-old bug.
For overhauling the Cygwin pipe code to make XEmacs unusable.
For fixing a long-standing bug in screen.
For inventing the plush hippo award.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For finding and fixing a nasty CPU register corruption bug.
For getting autorebase working in setup.
For integrating Mintty shortcuts into setup.
For combining fileutils, sh-utils, and textutils into coreutils.
For obviating the dreaded TS hack.
For years of service and dedicated maintainership of important Cygwin packages.
For providing a Linux-like environment in Windows for 25 years.
For being an example of reasonable discussion on the list.
For adopting ruby and its many associated packages.
For recording zero-size tarballs as successfully installed in setup, thereby de-annoying CGF.
For persistence to fix the Cygwin problems which turned up by working on the new gcc4 libstdc++ and libgfortran problems.
For fixing a broken build of gcc 4.3.0.
For uploading an experimental version of `gcc`.
For succinctly summarizing how to fix a bug.
For exemplary use of reasoning powers.
For going above and beyond the expected volunteer effort (with the `chere` package).
For maintaining subversion for the last 12 (!) years.
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For providing short, simple, easy to reproduce testcases in plain C.
For finding a mistake in a package upload before the announcement was even sent.
For tracking down the fseeko() after fdopen() problem in source code.
For being a great package coordinator on `cygwin-apps`.
For adopting and revamping the vital `base-files` package.
For maintaining lots of packages over the years.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For obsoleting ash with its attendant stone-age code.
For offering a nice summation of the problems with mismatched dlls, along with a cogent suggestion for dealing with the problem.
For adopting and updating the `coreutils` package.
For enlightening people on the properties of `/cygdrive`.
For standing up and enforcing the GPL.
For pointing out how to subscribe to the Cygwin list without receiving all the mail.
For finding and fixing a nasty CPU register corruption bug.
For educating the community on `gcc` versioning.
For numerous Cygwin `setup` contributions leading to resizeability.
For tracking down incorrect identification of non-Cygwin processes and sticking by it.
For I can't really tell what.
For conspicuous service on behalf of the Cygwin community.
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For kicking butt on CWD handling.
For reminding us of the right way to handle a FAQ.
For his highly appreciated commitment to maintaining Cygwin documentation over the last couple of years.
For years of service maintaining the `base-files` and `base-passwd` packages.
For quietly taking over the `libfontconfig1` and `libfontconfig-devel` packages (slightly retroactive).
For 14 years of contributions to Cygwin.
For years of supporting `postgres`, and for just being a long time contributor to Cygwin.
For creating a central archive of package build repositories.
For automating away the manual work in identifying noarch packages .
For developing `calm` as a replacement for `upset`.
For coding a replacement for incver_ifdep in setup. No, I don't know what that does but people seem to be very happy about it. Inquiring Minds will have to read the thread.
For spontaneously fixing a bug in upset.
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For creating a modern, spec-compliant solution in xwin-xdg-menu.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For finding and fixing a nasty CPU register corruption bug.
For integrating Mintty shortcuts into setup.
For dramatically improving the speed of `setup`.
For taking over maintainership of Cygwin/X after years of neglect.
For long service maintaining many packages for Cygwin.
For overhauling the Cygwin pipe code to make XEmacs unusable.
For revamping the FIFO code in Cygwin.
For adopting the `libXpm-noX` package. (Whatever that is. Only Ken and Jon know.)
For a heroic 1-2 punch on a bug.
For going to great lengths to track down a regression.
For getting a `luajit` patch in upstream.
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For finding and fixing a nasty CPU register corruption bug.
For improving the project documentation on his own initiative.
For the "Cygwin night at the OSCAs" concept (need I say more?).
For creating new mean slogans for CGF to use.
For finding and fixing a nasty CPU register corruption bug.
For the most on-topic and painful pun.
For long service, good advice, and a determination to help.
For updating the URLs in cygport to https.
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For taking over YA orphaned, non-64 bit package.
For adopting and rebuilding the `singular` package.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For rebuilding pure-ftpd, to allow dropping libopenssl098.
For showing initiative wrt Cygwin infrastructure at this juncture.
For lifetime contribution to the Cygwin project.
For finding a 13-year-old bug in getservent.
For the truly heroic effort of understanding and documenting how `cygtls` works.
For "sheer cleverness" (a.k.a. saying it with sheet music).
For pointing out what should have been obvious.
For wisely redirecting what could have been an HTML email flame war into the hippo zone.
For high quality contributions that touched many parts of the Cygwin DLL.
For providing data to help track down a bug.
For not being afraid to climb on that ol' soapbox re: 3PPs.
For shocking and audacious disservice to the community.
For offering a simple solution to a long-standing problem.
For actually testing a snapshot unbidden and reporting that it fixed a problem.
For tireless support of the setup command line.
For conspicuous service to the Cygwin community.
For an attempt to apply a creative solution to a problem.
For being mentally prepared to take over maintainership of `perl`.
For tracking down and fixing a screen corruption bug in `screen`.
For patching setup to allow it to run as non-admin.
For efforts in adopting a tough package (`emacs`).
For patching and debugging screen version 5 for Cygwin.
For fixing complex and difficult to reproduce bugs.
For overhauling the Cygwin pipe code to make XEmacs unusable.
For adding support for pseudo-consoles in the Cygwin DLL, so console applications can work in PTYs like mintty, ssh, GNU screen, or tmux.
For fixing a long-standing bug in screen.
For picking up the problematic `ImageMagick` package and making it functional.
For being the go-to guy (GTG) for GTG.
For redesigning the Cygwin logo in setup.
For clearly explaining why security is hard.
For maintaining a lot of packages for many years. Like, more than everyone else put together. Really.
For helping with the Great Perl Update of 2015.
For helping to clean obsolete packages from the distro.
For creating a repository of Linux-to-Cygwin cross-compilers for Fedora.
For cleaning up some ugly old scripts.
For taking over maintainership of Cygwin/X after years of neglect.
For pointing out that package maintainers should use snapshots.
For a clever use of utilities.
For contributing a brand new 64-bit Windows system.
For their invaluable efforts in bringing future cygwin users into the world.
